meanings.definition: To lure or entice (someone or something) into a trap or a harmful situation.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox was decoying the rabbit with a shiny object.
meanings.sent2: The hunter was decoying ducks using a duck call.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was decoying the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The villain was decoying the hero into a dangerous trap.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the flowers was decoying the bees to the garden.

meanings.definition: The act of luring or enticing someone or something into a trap or a harmful situation.
meanings.sent1: The decoying of the innocent bird led to its capture.
meanings.sent2: The decoying of fish with bait is a common fishing technique.
meanings.sent3: The decoying of the tourists with fake souvenirs was a clever scam.
meanings.sent4: The decoying of the spy into revealing secrets was a success.
meanings.sent5: The decoying of the mice into the trap was swift and effective.
